thread.title: 45 After Dark: The 'Vlad the Emailer' edition
thread.title_full: 45 After Dark: The 'Vlad the Emailer' edition - POLITICO

author: politico.com
title: 45 After Dark: The 'Vlad the Emailer' edition
text:
The Obama administration on Friday finally laid bare what it had been tiptoeing around for months: Vladimir Putin directed the massive, systematic cyber attacks on the U.S. election. The official, declassified report — prepared by the CIA, FBI and NSA — stated “Russia’s goals were to undermine public faith in the U.S. democratic process, denigrate Secretary Clinton, and harm her electability and potential presidency.”
The report lays out the government’s most extensive argument to date that the senior Moscow officials directed a series of disruptive election-season hacks that hit the Democratic Party and Hillary Clinton’s campaign . The report also detailed how Russian officials developed "a clear preference" for President-elect Donald Trump and "aspired to help President-elect Trump’s election chances” whenever possible.
Trump himself, who met with intelligence officials Friday for a briefing on the report, had a different take: “There was absolutely no effect on the outcome of the election including the fact that there was no tampering whatsoever with voting machines,” the next president said in a written statement.
Nowhere in his statement did Trump address the culprits behind the election-season cyberattacks, POLITICO’s Louis Nelson .
